content.question: A student dissolves <math alttext="8.00 grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8.00</mn><mtext> g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="N H 4 N O 3 solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in <math alttext="100 decimal point, grams" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100.</mn><mtext> g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H 2 O liquid" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> in a coffee-cup calorimeter. Based on the initial and final temperatures of the mixture in degrees Celsius shown in the diagram above the laboratory setup, what is the calculated <math alttext="delta T" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> of the water reported to the appropriate number of significant figures?

skill.text: 2.D: Make observations or collect data from representations of laboratory setups or results, while attending to precision where appropriate.
